tika.dc.description:
Reprint of "Sizzling in Sidney" originally printed in Bad Boys Down Under

They Come from Different Worlds

Cameron Crane's a bad boy billionaire, a guy who quit school to surf and ended up founding a surfing empire in his native Australia. Cam's got big plans for Crane Enterprises. To break into the California surfing market he hires marketing genius Jennifer Talbot from San Francisco, a cool blonde who's brilliant at what she does. A man who likes control, he decides even before she gets off the plane that he'll sleep with her just to make sure he keeps the upper hand. When he meets his sexy consultant he's even more determined to mix business and pleasure.

Jen's never met a man who was less subtle. With his loud shirts, his reputation for outrageous behavior and his crazy work hours, Cam's not exactly her dream client. He is sexy, though, in that barely civilized way of his. Even if she didn't have a rule about getting involve with clients, she has a man waiting for her at home who is respectable, compatible, perfect for her in every way. Maybe he doesn't make her skin hum when he's near, but he's exactly the kind of man she should marry.

The easiest way to keep her distance from the hot CEO is to be all business. Which would be easier if the business wasn't surfing and Cam didn't insist on teaching her to ride the waves on one of his boards to help her market the product. Sun Kissed is the first of three contemporary romantic comedies about opposites who deep down may have more in common than they think.
